summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2019 between attorneys and federal prosecutors regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein and the subsequent legal and investigative processes. It includes a detailed preservation request for evidence related to Epstein's detention and death, and discussions about attorney-client privilege review of seized electronic media.

persons.name: Michael Miller
persons.context: Primary federal prosecutor recipient of emails; coordinating communication regarding the Epstein case and evidence review.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on emails discussing legal procedures following Epstein's death.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: Attorney representing Epstein's family, sending detailed preservation requests for evidence related to Epstein's detention and death, and discussing privilege issues.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case; the emails discuss the investigation into his death and the preservation of evidence from his detention.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as having personal counsel to whom an identical preservation request will be sent.

connections.description: Weinberg states he had prior privileged communications with Epstein and is now acting for Epstein's family/estate.
Prosecutor and defense attorney communicating about case procedures, evidence preservation, and privilege reviews.
Weingarten is included as defense counsel in communications about the case.
Weinberg indicates he will send an identical preservation request to Mark Epstein's personal counsel.

events.title: Epstein's Imprisonment Begins
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was imprisoned/detained starting on this date.

events.title: Reported Epstein Suicide Attempt
events.description: An occurrence investigated as an attempted suicide by Epstein at the MCC.

events.title: Night Before Epstein's Death
events.description: The evening through which video and access records to Epstein's cell are requested for preservation.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: Preservation Request and Legal Coordination
events.description: Email chain where attorney Martin Weinberg sends a comprehensive evidence preservation request to prosecutors and they discuss privilege review procedures for seized devices.

keyFacts: A comprehensive preservation request was made for all evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein's detention and death, including videos, logs, medical records, and any note found in his cell.
The request highlights a prior incident on July 23, 2019, investigated as an attempted suicide by the MCC.
The government acknowledges an FBI investigation into Epstein's death has been initiated and states it will be 'extremely rigorous.'
There is discussion about establishing a 'taint team' to review seized electronic media to protect attorney-client privileged communications.
Martin Weinberg is authorized by the 'Estate attorney' to have preliminary conversations with prosecutors on behalf of Epstein's family.
